alert.note: Alert for Bolivar Peninsula; Brazoria Islands; Galveston Island; Matagorda Islands (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued October 04 at 3:06AM CDT until October 04 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. For the Coastal Flood Statement, isolated minor coastal flooding. * WHERE...Gulf-facing beaches, including the Matagorda Peninsula, Brazoria County beaches, Galveston Island and the Bolivar Peninsula. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through Thursday morning. For the Coastal Flood Statement, until 9 AM CDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Some water on low lying roads and property. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A summary of potential impacts from minor coastal flooding: * Slight overwash of water at the intersection of Highway 87 and Highway 124 and other lowest-lying locations on the Bolivar Peninsula. * Waves could runup close to parts of the Galveston Seawall, as well as Blue Water Highway and Beach Drive in Surfside.
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways. Swim near a lifeguard and away from rocks, jetties, and piers. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Bolivar Peninsula; Brazoria Islands; Galveston Island; Matagorda Islands
